column4: ok well, i would of thought you were using a vesa driver but its not coming up that way
i have fglrx installed (had problems too ) and fell back it come up with vesa
when i did dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg i ended up with vesa
when i have a ati1300 and default is vesa unless i decided to install my fglrx driver
well is there a general way to backup any video driver, or is it different for different drivers?
I tried that and it doesn't work because the driver on ati's website has the same name I think so it overwrites the one I currently have, or something like that
i just backup the xorg.conf   cp /etc/X11/xorg.conf /etc/X11/xorg.conf.bak
basically the xorg.conf file looks exactly the same after I upgrade as it does now, but the driver is different, I have no "direct rendering" with the proprietary driver
thats what is used to make the driver
do updatedb  then do locate ati-driver
do sudo updatedb  then do sudo locate ati-driver
ok I did that, and I got no output from either command...  I used "sudo updatedb"
well that locate should of found it. guess we are out of tricks here, sorry.
